text: The Norbulingka Institute was founded in 1988,Norbulingka Institute Central Tibetan Administration by the present 14th Dalai Lama at Sidhpur, near Dharamsala, India. The institute helps to preserve the Tibetan language and culture. The institute is named after Norbulingka, the traditional summer residence of the Dalai Lamas, in Lhasa, Tibet. The main building is a replica of the Norbulingka palace in LhasaNorbulingka Institute Exile as challenge: the Tibetan diaspora, by Dagmar Bernstorff, Hubertus von Welck.
